meanings.sent1: The doctor overprescribes antibiotics for every little cold.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist worries that the doctor may overprescribe painkillers.
meanings.sent3: The nurse joked that the doctor must think everyone needs a pharmacy in their pocket with how much he overprescribes.
meanings.sent4: The veterinarian overprescribes treats for the dog, thinking it will solve all his problems.
meanings.sent5: The teacher overprescribes homework, making it impossible for students to have a life outside of school.

meanings.sent1: She overprescribes rest to her patients, thinking it will cure all their ailments.
meanings.sent2: The hospital policy aims to prevent doctors from overprescribing unnecessary tests.
meanings.sent3: The therapist playfully accused her colleague of overprescribing naps to their clients.
meanings.sent4: The coach overprescribes water breaks during practice, making the players lose focus.
meanings.sent5: The nutritionist overprescribes vitamins, believing they are the solution to all health issues.

meanings.definition: To issue a prescription for more medication than necessary.
meanings.sent1: The clinic overprescribes painkillers, leading to a rise in addiction cases.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are trained to avoid overprescribing medication to prevent adverse effects.
meanings.sent3: The pharmacy technician teased the new intern for overprescribing band-aids for minor cuts.
meanings.sent4: The psychiatrist overprescribes sleeping pills, neglecting to address the root cause of insomnia.
meanings.sent5: The dentist overprescribes fluoride treatment, believing it will magically fix all dental issues.
